stance_1: I am happy with vegetarian meals
stance_2: I include meat to make meals complete
justification: The interviewee states both that meat is needed to make meals complete and that they are happy with vegetarian meals, which are in tension.

stance_1: I am happy with vegetarian meals
stance_2: People around me prefer meat with every meal
justification: The interviewee explicitly contrasts their own happiness with vegetarian meals with others' preference for meat in every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat every two or three days
stance_2: People around me prefer meat with every meal
justification: The interviewee explicitly states they eat meat less frequently than people around them, who prefer it with every meal.

stance_1: I eat meat every two or three days
stance_2: I am happy with vegetarian meals
justification: Being happy with vegetarian meals supports and is consistent with eating meat only every two or three days.

stance_1: I eat meat every two or three days
stance_2: I enjoy fish and eggs as protein
justification: The interviewee states a preference for fish and eggs as proteins, which supports eating meat less frequently.

stance_1: I include meat to make meals complete
stance_2: I eat meat every two or three days
justification: The belief that meat completes meals supports including meat regularly, though not at every meal.
